name: untempered
content:
untempered adjective
(NOT CONTROLLED)
Add to word list
Add to word list
formal not limited or controlled, or made less extreme: The prosecutor made untempered and provocative references to the evidence in his summing up. The game of Monopoly is about deal-making and untempered capitalism.
More examplesFewer examplesFear and anger are essentially untempered emotions, the raw products of the elemental mind.The book was an untempered account of how senior courtiers had set out to destroy the princess.Company shares continue to rise, and enthusiasm for its products remains untempered.

untempered adjective
(NOT CHANGED)
